text: Right now we are in Gothenburg, Sweden. We are only

stop starring at peoples feet.
Welcome to Stockholm, Sweeden. We are on our last stop in

today. I hear is very Swedish. I don't know why, because it is

Once again, welcome here at city hall in Stockholm, and I will
be your guide for this tour that will last about 45 minutes
The city hall in Stockholm was built between 1911 and 1923
When the city hall was built it had 3 functions and still has 3
functions today. First of all it is a political building. 200 people
come here, this is where the city council of Stockholm has their
meetings. Secondly this is a big banquet hall. We have about
300 events each year. That means almost 1 event per day. And
lastly, but not least, this is a building for visitors. It was very
important to the architect that the building would be open, that
you can come here, have a look at the architecture and maybe
come back one day.
Sweeden is a country where its cold, 6 months out of the year.
You might wonder how do we heat a building like this? If you

look above the door you can see that 
 there is a big hole. That is
how we heat it. There is big holes like that in every room, where
hot air is let out. But this is the only room where we cannot
cover it it up. In other rooms it's behind furniture, arts, we can't
see it. But in here it is visible.
We are in the Vasa museum and as you can see behind me,
this is the Vasa ship. Built in 1628. Correct. Thank you for
